benchmark_details.name: SYMPCODER
benchmark_details.overview: SYMPCODER is a human-annotated dataset derived from Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS) reports, designed to benchmark the performance of models for symptom coding in medical contexts. It includes three variants targeting both common and rare symptoms.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating model performance across diverse cases in medical symptom coding.

data.source: Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS) reports
data.annotation: Human-annotated by a team of experts following a rigorous validation process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the two-stage evaluation framework assessing linking accuracy and mention coherence.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in EM and Fuzzy metrics indicate better model performance in accurately linking symptoms and extracting coherent mentions.
methodology.validation: The dataset underwent thorough annotation and validation by trained annotators and validators.
